title.native: 慎重勇者～この勇者が俺ＴＵＥＥＥくせに慎重すぎる～
title.romaji: Shinchou Yuusha: Kono Yuusha ga Ore TUEEE Kuse ni Shinchou Sugiru
title.english: Cautious Hero: The Hero Is Overpowered but Overly Cautious

description: The goddess Rista summons a hero to help her hard mode video game-like world. The hero, Seiya, is exceptional in every way, but he is incredibly cautious to the point of buying three sets of armor (one to wear, a spare, and a spare for the spare) and going full power against weak slimes (just in case).
synonyms: This Hero is Invincible but "Too Cautious"
慎重勇者～这个勇者明明超强却过分慎重～
ผู้กล้าสุดแกร่ง ขี้ระแวงขั้นวิกฤติ

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

title.native: この勇者が俺ＴＵＥＥＥくせに慎重すぎる
この勇者が俺ＴＵＥＥＥくせに慎重すぎる
異世界かるてっと 2

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AmaaTodd)

Originating from [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). Currently freelance.

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AmaaTodd)

Originating from [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). Currently freelance.

She started off as a painter in the early '80s, and then switched to photography work. Stopped doing photography when animation switched to digital and nowadays just focuses on special effects.

Titular member of Team Taniguchi, a subsidiary of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) specializing in special effects.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AmaaTodd)

Originating from [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). Currently freelance.
Hometown: Ooita Prefecture, Japan Facebook | Website (blog) | Twitter Itai Yoshitaka (板井義隆) is a Japanese CG artist, CG designer and animator.

MYTH & ROID is a musical unit consisting of music producer [Tom-H@ck](https://anilist.co/staff/107596/Tomohiro-Oshima), lyricist [hotaru](https://anilist.co/staff/150361/hotaru), and vocalist [KIHOW](https://anilist.co/staff/220691/). In 2017, the original vocalist, Mayu Maeshima, left the unit and was replaced by KIHOW.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

Episode 9 - This Reaper Is Just Too Invincible
Episode 10 - This Man Is Too Strong for Being So Old
Episode 11 - The Truth Is Too Much to Bear
Episode 12 - The Hero Is Overpowered But Overly Cautious
